heisigStory: The appearance of the primitive for water in its full form tells us that we have something to do with water here. The extra drop to the left, added as a second stroke, changes the picture from a splash caused by a walking stick dropped into water to form an icicle. If it helps, when you hold an icicle up to the light, you can usually see little crystallizations of five-pointed stars inside of it, which is the shape we have in this kanji.
koohiiStory1: Icicles start with 1 frozen drop of water.
koohiiStory2: A drop in temperature turns water into an icicle.
